intro: Guatteria multinervis, commonly known as the Guatteria with multivenation, is a tropical evergreen shrub belonging to the family Marcaceae. It is characterized by its dense, glossy, elliptical leaves that have prominent veins, giving it its scientific name. The plant produces small, fragrant white flowers that are clustered in panicles, followed by edible, fleshy berries. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in the understory of tropical rainforests. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens.
